channel.title: Time Remaing for 317 PI?
channel.description: how would i go about making time remaining for a minigame on a 317 PI?

item.title: Time Remaing for 317 PI?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:3, topic:515315”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=633568.msg4279666#msg4279666 date=1365361125]
Instead of making the timer local, you’d have to do it globally through server.java.

Creating a separate class for the minigame would be best.

Make a method that will contain all of the data that you want to be updated regularly… For example

public void process() {
if (minigameTimer > 0)
minigameTimer--;

//. . .
}

Then you can put that in your Server class

Minigame.process();

[/quote]

so this would make it where like how in castle wars it counts down saying time remaining?[/quote]

Yes, it would allow a timer to be created for the game, then you’d do some simple math to calculate the time remaining.

blakeman8192:

why the love would you use the process method noobs

JavaLearner:

Why not use the Eventhandling?

I’m sure he’s not worried about efficiency

Read full topic
